Reviews.Title: “Private luxury in a Turkish bath”
Reviews.Author: PennyLibrary
Reviews.Content: Wanting to experience a Turkish bath, but hesitant to bare all in a public setting, I chose to use the facilities at the Byzantium Hotel. They choice was based on location and reputation of the hotel. I tried to make the reservation via the internet, but when I showed up early to see if they had received it there was no record. No problem for they could take me right then. It was a comfortable experience even the rigorous massage, I knew I would have bruises afterwards but didnâ€™t, just well limbered up. I felt truly pampered and probably the cleanest I had ever been. That may sound strange but the exfoliation of dried skin is amazing to behold! The price was 70 Euros and I found it expensive, but probably worth it for the privacy factor. It is second on my list of baths for return visits. First would be the Cemberlitas, thirdly the Cagaloglu Hamami, and lastly the Ayasofya Hurrem Sultan Hamam.

Reviews.Title: “Byzantium, Good service Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: shaaheen s
Reviews.Content: Really Exellent location, a quick step to the Blu Mosque , Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi museum, also close to Dedi Effendi house. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially Ordan & shaaheen i think. Make Sure you get the sea view room or the slighlty bigger rooms, Dont book the tiny room. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable room and attentive personel”
Reviews.Author: GGulya
Reviews.Content: Location is really amazing in the heart of the old city. It is very close to all sightseeings. Personel tried to do everything to make my stay more comfortable, especially, Mr. Baran Yatchin and Orkhan Karakash. Thank you very much for such attitude and esxelent service within my 9-night stay. If I visit Istanbul once more, I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on the perfect street in the perfect neighborhood. It is walking distance to most of the major attractions in Istanbul including the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar... the list goes on! there is a smaller Bazaar just around the corner and the restaurants and bars in the area are lively and safe! Truly no worries! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms are very nice. The rooftop terrace restaurant offers a breathtaking view of the sea of Marmara and the beautiful backdrop of the city's amazing sights. I would definitely stay here again if I ever am lucky enough to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophier88
Reviews.Content: very central to all the main attractions in ISTANBUL,stayed there with my hubby and 11 yr old daughter,3 beds lined up like sardines!! clean bathroom and room , clean sheets every 2 days ..lovely restaurants next to this hotel ,only 1 thing ..we went in feb ,it was very cold and the room was very hot , better then been cold i guess...stay there... its friendly n helpful staff ..love ISTANBUL ..great place to visit ..i would stay at this hotel again !!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Johhku
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel in March/12 - 2,5 stars out of 5. Nice lobby, nice staff ... Only mediocre breakfast, cold rooms and very expensive SPA services. The rooftop terrace is nice, but too cold during the cold months. Don't pay extra for this hotel if you want the SPA, since you can visit it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “This is a review of the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: alimariew
Reviews.Content: Our first night in Istanbul we didn't want to go far so we stopped pretty much at the first place we saw. The entire street is lined with restaurants all offering similar cuisine at similar prices. This place was maybe one or two Lira cheaper but TJ was outside trying to charm people into eating there. He did a good job and to reward his efforts we stepped inside. We were also treated to complimentary baklava at the end of our meal. Now for the food. I ordered the sultana lamb and my friend the chicken kabaps. My Sultana was wonderfully displayed and delicious and my friend loved her meal as well. The only bummer was that the rice portion was so small. I think in the US we expect more of the filler and less of the meat & veggies. I had a chicken kebap this afternoon at a different restaurant and it was not half as good as the one from The Byzantium. Service was good, they had a good view, although it was hard to see at night, and the next day TJ waved to us and even remembered our names! Definitely a tourist restaurant. I'm sure cheaper and better fare could be had with a little more searching but it was certainly worth a stop for the hungry & tired traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: wagmut
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for the main sights in Sultanahmet. The street has loads of cafes and restaurants. Blue Mosque, Aya Sophi, Topkapi Palace are all within 5 minutes walk. Grand Bazaar 15 minutes. If you arrive by boat at Eminonu and are travelling light then you can walk to hotel in 25 minutes (passing through the spice bazaar on the way). The hotel looks like it has been refurbished recently and is very clean etc. Great view from the enclosed roof terrace of the sea and the Blue Mosque etc. The staff are helpful. The buffet breakfast isn't very exciting but is average for Istanbul. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: cinc123
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel is perfectly nestled in quaint neighborhood on a quiet street, less than 5 minutes walk to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The area of Sultanahmet is filled with shops and restaurants. The Tram line is very close and a walk to the water's edge was under 10 minutes. The staff were helpful. Rooms were great value: Nothing fancy, but there was a great bed, clean sheets and hot water for the shower. A rooftop terrace gave us wonderful views of the mosques and the sea. I would definitely recommend to friends and when I return to Istanbul, stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Pity about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: We booked the dearest type of room in this hotel on the website but when we arrived we were given a room ( in an annex) in which the wallpaper was patched and even peeling at the joints. When we complained we were shown 2 other rooms (again both in the annex) but if these were the dearer rooms goodness knows what a standard room was like. When I said these were unacceptable we were told if we stayed the first night in the original room we would get a better room in the morning. We did indeed get shown yet another room the next morning and although it was bigger, it was still in the annex and there was an unpleasant smell in the corridor outside the room. Not wanting to spent the rest of our short holiday trying to get a decent room we reluctantly accepted it. On the third night we were awoken by what sounded like a fire alarm. Unsure I phoned reception who said it was being dealt with and to ignore it. Although the alarm eventually stopped it intermittently sounded throughout the night and so our nights sleep was ruined. When we reported this to reception in the morning we were again assured it would be fixed. When we returned to the hotel that night the alarm again sounded but I was again assured it was being fixed. When the alarm keep sounding intermittantly I traced it to the alarm in the lift that stopped outside our room and only then did the staff admit that it was not goiung to be fixed until the following date. As this would mean another sleepless night I said it was unacceptable. The staff then offered to solve the problem by switching off power to the lift but as we were on the fifth floor and this was the only lift in the annex this was still clearly unacceptable. When I said so I was then eventually offered another room in the main part of the hotel. Apart from all this hassle the hotel is in an excellent location in the old town and most of the staff are very friendly. But because of the poor standard of the accommodation we were given and the equally poor response of the staff to our legitimate concerns I could not recommend this hotel to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Really good Quality-price”
Reviews.Author: DiniG
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful city of Istanbul. For the first time you visit Istanbul you must be in the area of â€‹â€‹Sultanameth. Then it is easier to arrive at St. Sophia and the tokapi palace early in the morning. The Byzantium Hotel is in the sector which is the most tourist. The only drawback is the size of the room, it's a bit small. The night is silent in the rooms even though the streets are animated in front the hotel. Breakfast is corect, not much variety but everything is well. The staff was very friendly and professional. The rooms are clean. For the price, it is an very interesting hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved our hotel and the city!”
Reviews.Author: carolcole
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a week in istanbul and the byzantium hote. the hotel was wonderful and the staff was supeerb. especiallyorhan. he was extremly professional and helpful, not to mention, pleasant. the hotel was clean and the location was in walking distance to all major sites. we had a room overlooking the street and it was lovely. we kept our window open all the tme and was able to hear the "call to prayer" the breakfast was pretty good and gave us a great start to a fun day of sightseeing.i would highy recommend the byzantiu. carol c from nashville tn usa.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid class hotel”
Reviews.Author: rvrman21
Reviews.Content: What made this place was the great staff, EVERYONE went out of there way to help. Room was small but clean and ok. Free wi-Fi in room a bonus. Great position for all tourist spots. One tip -- get a sea view room I would probably not be so enthusiastic if I was at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel in a splendid historical site”
Reviews.Author: niushamn
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a roomy and cozy space in the most splendid historical site in Istanbul. The suite at Byzantium Hotel and Suites proved to be a wonderful experience. The room was large enough to house a queen and a single bed in addition to a converted sofa double bed. The room was equipped with a refrigerator, a sink, flat screen TV and a small Jacuzzi-bath tub. The room did not have coffee maker and the only English news channel was BBC international. The breakfast table was small but included all the essential elements. The hotel crews were polite and considerate and we found them to be most reasonable in all our dealings. But our most memorable moments belong to the beautiful neighborhood that the hotel enjoys, a lively and colorful street with lots of nicely sized old buildings, leading gracefully to the most gorgeous sites of Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: marionrr
Reviews.Content: Our local travel agent had chosen The Byzantium and I'd definitely recommend it to others. The location, right in the middle of Sultanahmet, just minutes from Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar was perfect. It's a 5 minute walk from all the attractions but in a cozy neighborhood. We paid a very reasonable rate through our travel agent. Our room was simple but well kept and spotlessly clean! One light was malfunctioning but we had English-language TV and all comforts that we needed. The bed was very comfortable and the street noise abates around 10PM. We slept well! A copious breakfast is included. Great coffee as you'd expect in Turkey, and cereal choices, juices, toast, cold cuts, cheeses, eggs as well as the more Turkish selections of olives, tomatoes and fruits. My best memory will be the roof terrace restaurant. We recuperated from our sightseeing every evening with a cool Effes beer on the roof from where you have amazing views over the city and the Bosporus. We spotted a large group of dolphins every evening along the shore while we were relaxing. I visited the Spa for a Turkish Bath. My massage therapist was great and the Spa was spotless! And last but not least: the front desk staff was incredibly helpful and kind, service in the hotel was very good!

Reviews.Title: “The terrace restaurant is good”
Reviews.Author: beextraordinary
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice light dinner on the terrace one evening, overlooking the Sea of Marmara. Tasty appetizer plate and a great bottle of wine. When you are out walking Akbiyik cad and each hotel/restaurant has a greeter claiming their place is the best, it's hard to choose. We went here on recommendation and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “In reality hotel looks nothing like the pictures of it”
Reviews.Author: LKl_MOW Posted by an Oktogo.ru traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is terrible! We booked it for our wedding anniversary trip and it was so bad, that we left the hotel after the first night, although we were booked for four nights. The hotel is extremely dark, no light in the corridors, the rooms was tiny, that it was hard to move around. The bathroom is more of a joke than a real bathroom. Presumably, we were staying in a "superior room with see view".. We could see the sea - somewhere fay away. But much closer we could see the backyard with garbage, the wall of the next building and the window of the dorm next door - and we could even hear the people living in that place. Breakfast was ok, taken general quality of breakfast in the city, but the the breakfast room was a disaster - with holes and stains on the table cloths, a complete mess on the buffet and a waiter who did not even react to any requests. But the worst part of the hotel - reception staff. The lady who called herself "manager" was so rude, I could hardly believe my ears. A person like this should better work in the police station and not a hotel I would not recommend this hotel to anyone - not worth spending your money, especially of you come to Istanbul for a vacation and would like to have some proper service for your money

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Travel Bargain in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pdvasquez
Reviews.Content: THIS IS NOT A PAID REVIEW-This is the third time I've come to Istanbul and the third time I've stayed here. The first time was for a well deserved vacation. This hotel appealed to me then for its price and proximity to the "must see attractions in the historic district". Just a literal "stone's throw" from TopkapÄ± Palace, Hagia Sophia and Sultan Ahmed Mosque, perfect for touring. The hotel has a gorgeous Terrace Restaurant on the roof where you can experience one of the most incredible sunsets over the churches while, at the same time seeing the beautiful sea. Also, it is just a short walk to the Tram (Metro) line connecting you with the entire city for 2 TL ($1). After staying here and experiencing the wonderful service and breakfast which is included, I've returned on business twice and decided to stay here. Even though my work was in Taskim, I had no problem taking the trams all the way to Taskim Square with one line change. You will be delighted by the service and the Reservations Manager Ms. Ebru Gerkan will attend to all your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Modern accommodations in historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: franktown
Reviews.Content: Hotel Byzantium offers modern hotel rooms and an excellent location with very fair pricing. The rooms are nothing to be excited over, but are clean and the hotel has wifi. The breakfast was a good way to start off our days, and the hotel staff was very welcoming. It's about a five minute walk to all the major sights in the city, and the rooftop restaurant offers amazing views with decent (though pricey!) food.

Reviews.Title: “Byzantium Hotel, Sultanhamet, Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Sparrow02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and excellent for exploring the top sites of Istanbul. The staff are friendly and very helpful and provide a good general all round service. The rooms are clean but basic and if you are looking for a little more comfort, it is worth upgrading to the deluxe rooms on offer. Toiletries are provided daily and are plentiful. Breakfast is basic, but you can usually find something to eat. Although it is generally a cold buffet, selection of dried fruits, tomato, cucumber, two to three different cheeses and a selection of cold meats, (with the exception of a pan of scrambled egg and frankfurter like sausages on a hot plate), there is no yogart, limited fresh fruit and the orange juice and coffee provided are not fresh (powdered orange juice and machine coffee). We managed mainly on fresh bread, with a little cheese or jam which we found sufficient. It is definitely worth taking a travel kettle and some tea and coffee supplies as the hotel rooms do not provide this facility. I am not a hotel inspector, but based on my experience, I think it would probably be representative of a good three star hotel in the UK. Overall I would say if you want a cheap, clean, friendly and central hotel, then this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “great location, poor management”
Reviews.Author: kubra_a
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the hotel, didnt have any problems during my first stay. Thought that it was at a great location and the staff were very helpful. However, upon returning from my holiday i recieived an email from hotel management accusing me off under-paying for my stay and that I had been put on a 'black list'.. I had made a booking online and agreed to the price that I was notified of. However, when i got to the hotel, the receptionist charged me from a much lower price for the same room (I had not asked for any discounts). The hotel management did not bother to speak to me while I was still at the hotel, rather decided to email me with false accusations. I dont have any negative comments on the location nor services that are provided with the hotel. But I dont think I deserved these accusations when all I did was pay the amount that the receptionist had said to me...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in excellent location with great service - would definitely rebook!”
Reviews.Author: emeraldgreen65
Reviews.Content: The Byzantium is perfectly placed in the Sultanahmet region of Istanbul within walking distance of all the main attractions. The hotel is situated on a charming cobbled street with many bars and restaurants with terraces on the street and on the rooves. Full of character. The rooms are spotlessly clean, spacious enough and with good aircon. Very quiet at night despite being on the street side. Comfy beds and pillows, and super powerful showers. The management is excellent with an exceptional manager, Orhan Harakas. He went out of his way to be helpful with advice, reservations and recommendations. He even managed to get my husband's passport ,which he had left in our room safe, to the airport on time so that we didn't miss the flight. Quite exceptional! Best of all the hotel has a fantastic bar/restaurant on the roof with the best view of Istanbul. A fabulous place to have a drink away from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with families or friends. No negative comments to make.

Reviews.Title: “The place to go if you are looking for a Private Turkish Hammam on SultanAhmet !”
Reviews.Author: walkingtheearth
Reviews.Content: We went to the Byzantium Hotel & Spa to tryout their Private Turkish Hammam experience we didn't know what to expect but had a great time! The Spa offers Female Therapists for Male & Female clients, so if you go as a couple this is an excellent option. The Turkish Hammam itself was small in size but enough for 2, the quality of the experience overall was much better than what you get in Public hamaam and they are not very restrictive about your draping, you can wear whatever suits your comfort level (this is common in most hotel based Hammams). We highly recommend this Hotel Spa for Private Turkish Hammam. The only downside i would say is that we felt the bath itself was a bit rushed, but still beats the 10 minutes or so you get at the public baths so can't really complain much !

Reviews.Title: “we loved it- excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: istanbulUk
Reviews.Content: the staff were very helpful and accomodating to our requests, mr orhan karaccas the manager was most helpful. i recommend this hotel to anyone visiting istanbul. also very close to the attractions. well worth the price i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: nickers82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the rooms even better. I don't know when they last renovated, but it appears to be recent. Our room was very comfortable, clean and modern. The bed was comfortable and such a great shower! The hotel is located on a fantastic street in Sultanahmet and tons of great restaurants are right outside the door. Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace are a quick walk around the corner. The walk to the ferries on the Bosphorus isn't bad, either. Hotel arranged a private airport transfer both coming and going for us. Was a bit pricey, but it happened when we wanted it to, not on the schedule for the local airport transfer service. Front desk had plenty of ideas and suggestions for how to fill our days in Istanbul. You can easily set up a guided tour with them, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: TSH
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location - short walking distance (2-3 minutes) from most attractions in Sultanahmet and great restaurants. Also, hotel offers free wi-fi. The breakfast is good, with a nice selection and variety. I arrived several hours prior to check-in and the hotel staff was kind enough to send me to breakfast (free of charge, although I didn't stay there the night before) while they got the room ready. I had booked a deluxe room with a city view, which on the website is described as having a king-size bed and an excellent view of the city. The first room I was shown had 2 queen-sized beds and looked out onto the small side street and the building across the way. I said that this is not the "excellent view of the city" they had advertised and asked to see another room. The next room I was shown can only be described as the smallest hotel room I had ever encountered in my 10+ years of traveling to Europe. It had a queen-sized bed against one wall and just enough space (approximately 1-2 meters) to walk along one side of the bed or along the foot of it. The bathroom was much more spacious; actually the bathroom was only slightly smaller than the room. There was no place to put the suitcase, there were no drawers for clothes (only a tiny, 1 meter wide hanging closet) and there is no way that 2 adults can use this room at the same time (one would have to sit on the bed to allow the other to walk around). However, the reason I settled on this room was because of the terrace. The terrace, shared with 3 other rooms, was wide, spacious, and had views of the Blue Mosque. The air-conditioning was mostly a fan (blew the air without cooling it).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Carol52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and this hotel was ideal for exploring the main sights in the Sultanahmet area. Our sea-view room was very good and the roof top terrace and restaurant were great .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly professional Service”
Reviews.Author: djw1949
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel in the Sultanahmet district near to all the main attractions. Staff were friendly and helpful particularly Cengiz the front office manager. Nice view from the top of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with stunning views from the terrace.”
Reviews.Author: Gjkingston
Reviews.Content: I'm in the airport after a week long stay at the Byzantium. Very friendly hotel, with prices negotiable for cash. Location is fantastic for the old town, and the popular street never gets too noisy, although it is always busy with diners.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed to stay at Byzantium”
Reviews.Author: mer65
Reviews.Content: I stayed there recently; did book my stay via tobook.com website. hotel location and services exc. for a short trip in Istanbul. enjoyed to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel' great location”
Reviews.Author: escada111
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice weeks stay . The beds were so large. Nice quiet and modernly designed room. All the staff are so kindly. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after looking on the internet and were not disappointed. The location is excellent and within seven minutes walk (slightly uphill) of the main sites. All Istanbul is hilly, but this location meant that I, with slight arthritis, was able to cope well. The outside of the hotel is deceptive and is better inside than at first glance. This is only a minor nag, but the interior can be a little gloomy when entering from the sun, so take care to remember the steps that start immediately behind the door. The reception staff are excellent, as is their English, and very obliging in every way, even allowing us free use of the computer behind the desk to check in on line when departing. The rooms are varied - we only had a standard room (204) that was appropriate for the four days we were there. When we arrived, having booked a king-size bed, we were shown two rooms and given the choice. Room 204 that we chose had two beds that soon became a king-size with no difficulty. Our only quibbles were the possible lack of drawer space for clothes, which again did not put us off as we travel very light, and the slight noises from outside. However, I am a light sleeper and my wife heard nothing.. I am sure that the suites are better equipped, so you get what you ask for. We reckon that the air-conditioning was still on a Winter setting as we had difficulty in lowering the room temperature. All these appear to be negative comments, but are really minor and did not spoil the holiday. Breakfast (7.15-10 AM) in the large dining room is very good with a wide variety of choice breads, fruit, cereals, meats, cheeses, olives, cake and Turkish Delight. The coffee (NescafÃ©) is better than many places we have visited. The choice can really set you up for the day or long morning, at least. Dinner can be taken on the top floor terrace with its marvellous view of St. Sophia and the Bosphorous, but the weather was a little cool at the time of our visit. However, the street is lined with restaurants where you can get an excellent three course meal and wine for 45 TL (around Â£19) or a fixed price at 15 TL (around Â£6.25) for a good and filling main course plus a drink. The sort of drink does vary, but is usually the choice between a Sprite/Coke-type or beer or water. Booking out is at 12, giving time to sleep in a bit if your flight time allows and also to visit some of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Great Deal & Location”
Reviews.Author: Jenius81
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with staff and their ability to accommodate the group of almost 30 people I coordinated to bring. They took us in a the very last second when were out of other options and made for an excellent experience. Their price on rooms, meeting space and food was reasonable and everything arranged was on time as promised. It took very little time and effort to work in changes to menus, schedules and last second needs. I feel like I made lasting friends at this hotel and the location is really great. The street it is on has a lot of fun restaurants, bars and cafes. It is a fun place to be, but certainly not out of control. I would highly recommend staying here to anyone looking for a no hassle, good priced hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: miranbaban
Reviews.Content: our experiences were amazing! the location is strategic most of the tourrist attraction in Slutanahmet are within walking distancs e.g. the blue mosque is only 3-5 minutes walk. our room was a suit and it was spacious, tidy and clean. the breakfast is full of variety and I am sure it will satisfy most of the peoples. the staffs are friendly and very willing to help, many of them are able to speak english fluently. there is a staff manager by the name "Cengis" who's very helpful and professional. The only negative point about this hotel is to mind door steps. even I donot think this is an issue as pavement and road in Istanbul is full of hazards i.e. not even.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel misrepresented!”
Reviews.Author: patriziphoto
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 triple deluxe rooms. The pictures on the internet are not even close. There was no couch and 2 very small beds in one of the rooms, and the view to the giant pile of trash 2 floors down. Hotel staff not very nice really. But... The Location was superb!!! I would not stay there again but would find better spot on same street.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Visrams
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, central to the major tourist sites. Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi palace within 5 minutes walk. Hotel staff very helpful, friendly and courteous. Nothing was too much trouble to them. Made one feel totally at home-- especially Mr Cengis at the reception and Ms Ebru with always a big smile and friendly greetings. Would recomend this hotel to any one going to Istanbul. Would stay at this hotel the next time I am in Istanbul. Beautiful city and very warm lovely people. They made our holidat! Try out Ocean's 7 Restaurant just down the street as you turn left out of the hotel. Brilliant food. Mr Ebrahim the proprietor and the staff very friendly and helpful at all times. Made our meal times very enjoyable indeed!

Reviews.Title: “we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and found this nice hotel very well located to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Smudgey28
Reviews.Content: the hotel rooms especially the double rooms are quite comfirtable and very clean as the rooms are cleaned daily and all our bed sheets were also changed daily. the only disadvantage of this hotel is the street noise at night when the refuse collection lorries arrive at midnight and wake you up with a racket and the place next door also being renovated or such has deliveries in the middle of the night and goes on for at least 2 hours. There is nothing that this good hotel can do anything about it but even though i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who has a tight budget. Even the breakfast is really first class and you have free internet too. The staff are very polite and helpful. You can walk to the Blue mosque in less than 5 minutes and the tram is also very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Masood
Reviews.Content: The Byzantium hotel is located in sultanahmet, it's ACTUALLY only 5 or so minutes walk to the blue mosque,topkapi palace, hagia sophia (get out of the hotel, turn left walk through a very small amritza bazaar & your in the blue mosque grounds!) and 10/15 minutes walk to the grand bazaar!! We went for a family holiday, there were eight of us in total, so we did not want to spend alot of money on trams as my partner & I did on our previous trip to Istanbul. The tram service is also close by to visit the spice bazaar, bosphorus cruise to visit the asian side or other locations. The hotel is very good for a four star, with very nice comfortable rooms and spa and turkish hammam facilities available at a charge. The staff are very nice & helpful and the service was good. The only disappointment was the breakfast buffet, for a four star it was very basic, but the location of the hotel made up for that!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lenuk_81
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, there is no space for two people at all. There is not even space for clothes to hang. All our clothes were laying in the suitcase for that reason. The walls in rooms need to be renovated as they are all scratched does not correspond to a 4 star rating. In addition, it was impossible to rest in the hotel room as there is renovation going on in the next door hotel, the noise is impossible. The breakfast is plain, and same food is served everyday. On the other hand, must say that the location is perfect. The hotel is two minutes walk from all the sightseeng and there are a lot of good restaurants and bars around. The food is safe and good there. The views are amazing from the hotel room either to Bosphorus or Mosque. The staff are friendly enough however need to be more attentive to details.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: edNY16
Reviews.Content: I just loved this hotel. The staff are very helpful, polite, and attentive. Rooms are perfect. The rooms are clean, comfortable and they have amazing views. Prices are reasonable. The foods of the hotel's restaurant are delicious. When you drink something at the terrace, you may think that you are in dream because it is amazing. The location of the hotel is at the center of the city. It is close to every worth seeing centers of Istanbul. It is in the middle of the historical sites of both Ottoman Empire, and Byzantium. You can go to Sultanahmet Square where most important historical places of the Ottoman Empire and Byzantium are in, by walking in 5 minutes. It is also very close to Taksim, and you can enjoy the nightlife of Istanbul there. The neighborhood is very nice, people are very polite, and helpful, and also there are many beautiful places to drink or eat in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kcann
Reviews.Content: Very clean and basic hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Excellent location to all the sights. Stop by the Metropolis restaurant down the street, great staff, and good food.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnificiant hotel at Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Hasimato
Reviews.Content: " Very comforteble,great service,panoramic views convenlent location " Ä± would definitely recommend this hotel when visiting istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionaly friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CasaSulo
Reviews.Content: The friendly greeting continued throughout our New Year stay. Nothing was too much trouble and we were offered an upgrade on arrival due to it being empty - with the proviso that if the other guests arrived we move into our, "standard" room. That happened on our last night but it was no trouble and the house maids took care of everything while we went out for a tour and we had enjoyed the spectacular views of the Bosporus every day by then. The Byzantium Hotel is modern and traditional at the same time WIFI is free and fast. The decor throughout is in good clean condition and in a perfect position situated in the old town with restaurants and mini markets on the doorstep. The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar plus most of the other city attractions are all within an easy stroll. The breakfast was ample with fresh and dried fruits, yoghurt, cheeses, good coffee and bread to die for. Our room, 408, was spacious but there was a single bed in so that reduced the floor space considerably. The bathroom was "bijou" and we had a great game of, "hunt the loo roll" on our first visit. We discovered it under the sink and out of sight! The shower though was spacious, and had good pressure to the plentiful supply of hot water. There was one drawback whilst showering. There is an open vent on the outside wall which blows very cold and icy wind on one when staying in December but the rooms were warm - too warm for us and the air-con only operated on hot. We tried sleeping with the window open but soon discovered the air con pipe work on the outside wall, although insulated, still sounded like a 707 taking off when it kicked in at 6ish in the morning - along with the "morning call to prayers". There was a beautiful touch on NY day the bed was decorated with wonderfully scented flowers and roses Thank you all at the Byzantium for a memorable New Year Break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, excellent location for the sights!”
Reviews.Author: donalmca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a super street with little bars and restaurants and is located between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Any gripe was that the room was a bit small, but it was very clean and fine for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Would expect more for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: comfytraveller12
Reviews.Content: While its location near to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia was handy, this hotel doesn't have much else to offer from all the others. Basic rooms (advertised as a king size bed but it was just a double) and a little small, we expected more for the price and star rating. The included breakfast was terrible - the bread and eggs weren't replenished throughout the morning and there wasn't enough fresh fruit or the like. It's great to offer local food at breakfast but I think international traveller's needs ought to be taken into consideration as well. The reception staff were mixed - either reasonably friendly or else a little hostile. Cigarette smoke was often smelt coming through the crack in the door from the reception level and the first floor was very noisy - the restaurant next door was even doing renovations at midnight!

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap hotel in the center of the old city”
Reviews.Author: TeresaX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. It is a 5 minute walk to the Ayia Sophia, Blue Moske and the Topkapi Palace. The tram is also close which takes you to other parts of the city. Around the hotel there are plenty of shops, food markets and restaurants. The rooms are good, clean, roomy and big. The hotel was a Spa and sauna, turkish bath. To use this facilities one has to pay but it isnt vey expensive. The spa also offers massages and other treatments. The hotel has a nice terrace with a wonderfull view. The breakfast is ok but nothing special. It can be a bit noisy at times, not from inside the hotel but from outside-

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean hotel but slow breakfast service”
Reviews.Author: rodrigomw
Reviews.Content: The location is good. In the middle of the Old Istanbul. The bedroom is clean and confortable. The bathroom is clean. The breakfast service is slow and there are no fresh fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service at this perfectly located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Saimah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only a short walk from the Sultanahment tram stop. The location was a 5 minute walk to both the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. The hotel staff were very friendly and always on hand should you need them. We stayed a total of 5 nights in a triple room. We suffered a power cut on one of the nights which fused a couple of light bulbs and stopped our tv and phone working. These were fixed within minutes of me reporting it to reception. I would strongly recommend that you book a Turkish bath or spa treatment at the hotel and in warmer months I would recommend dining on the terrace - the views are lovely! The restaurants on the same street as the hotel are very expensive. The restaurant next door to the hotel is really cosy and the food is very good. There are alternatives closer to the tram line. All in all this was a wonderful place to stay whilst visiting this beautiful and historic city.

Reviews.Title: “A warm home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rsworldlink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Byzantium hotel from 12 - 16 November. We were picked up from the airport for free, since we stayed more than 3 nights. When we arrived at the hotel, the gentleman that checked us in took all the time to inform us about restaurants, things to do, best tours to take etc. Also we got served some delicious coffee. After that we were taken to our room. We had booked a Superior Sea View Double Room. The room was not totally what we had expeced. The view was defenitely beautiful, but the room itself was on the small side and so was the bathroom. We decided to ask if there was another room available, and yes there was. We were now taken to the other room that was at least twice the size. It was beautiful, with wooden floors. Also the bathroom was bigger and even had a jacuzzi tub. No upgrade was charged. It was lacking the nice view, but we were fine with it. Everybody in the hotel is just very friendly. Breakfast is included and is fine. The last day we used the Haman from the hotel. It was the best experience. We had to leave to the airport by 2.30 and they were so nice to let us stay in our room till that time. Istanbul is a wonderful city, I can recommend it to everyone. Beautiful and clean, at least the part we stayed at. People are very friendly. The hotel is perfectly located. Right in a very nice street with lots of restaurants. And very close to all the nice sight seeings. I will defenitely come back to Istanbul one day and will defenitely stay at the Byzantium again! Many thanks to the Staff at the Byzantium from the 2 dutch girls!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: Whatsunever
Reviews.Content: Although things werenÂ´t all as advertised (no WiFi on my floor until the last day of my stay), the staff was friendly. Maid service was excellent, breakfast buffet was large; however, it was the same every day. The Byzantium is close to AyaSofya (Hagia Sophia), the tramway, and lots of shopping. Great walking area, good price. Twice I asked for help in the room, was told I'd get it, and the person never materialized. Still, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: frida88
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice weeks stay at this superb hotel. Nice and quiet room. Very clean and tidy. The beds were so good. The service was ecxelent. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers003
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is in an excellent location in old town, within 5-10 minutes of the major sites and on a street with great restaurants. Decent breakfast included in rate. Cons: Small rooms in US standards, on par with some small European hotels, and bathroom is tiny! Sign posted in bathroom advises to not drink the water, but no free bottled water provided. I could not get the internet to work and the staff said they'd request help "tomorrow." Hotel arranged VIP airport transfers. Worked well coming in but on the way out, the driver picked us up in too small a car (had to hold luggage on lap) and then proceeded to drive us to the wrong airport and we almost missed our flight. Air conditioning runs but doesn't blow cold air. On a noisy street, the downside of the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ludo23
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel were very friendly and helpfull, from the reception desk to the cleaning staff. The location is between Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, in a tourist street full of restaurants and hotels. So very well located for visting Sultan Ahmet attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I would give it more stars!”
Reviews.Author: elapayumo01
Reviews.Content: Great Location, with close proximity to the blue mosque, Hagia Sophia. Friendly Staff, Generous service. Rooms are very Cosy. Says a lot if 4 seasons hotel is just a few steps away, but its a fraction of the price (but not the service!) . Loof for Cengiz, he sure will look after you!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MohamedUK
Reviews.Content: I rwad many reviews and am always worried if they reflect the excellence provided; the hotel and staff did not disappoint. The manager, Ginghis, was a perfect role model for all his staff.. Nothing was too difficult and was always with a smile. The room had the most perfect view of the sea and yet was located within walking distance of all the sights and smells of Sultanahmet - including the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Asya Sofiya. The tram station is within walking distance and allows access to all parts of Istanbul within minutes. By booking directly with the hotel, you can get an excellent deal with a free transfer for stays of 3 nights or more. Istanbul is a city we will visit again - we will definitely be staying at the Byzantium Hotel

Reviews.Title: “its a verey good hotel in the best part of old city and its so clean and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: negin109
Reviews.Content: its averey good hotel with good manager and evrey thing that you need you can found in this hotel for exampel turkish beth and ...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with Stunning views of the Marmara”
Reviews.Author: TreasuresofArabia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days.We were given a beautiful room with panoramic views of the Marmara. I would recommend, if you can, to spend the extra, the views amazing. I could see the Princess Islands from my bed. Coming from a busy city like Dubai, this was just what I needed for my vacation. The breakfast was good enough, even after 10 days, we were not bored...thats saying alot since I travelled with a fussy teenager, and she was happy enough....Thanks for including the Simit...The breakfast room was hot at most times, we were told that we could eat breakfast on the rooftop, but it was too hot, so we steyed in the lobby restuarant . I had the same rooftop view from my room anyway. The spa is chargeable, reasonable but EXCELLENT. I had a package treatment, the Hamam and a massage. The hamam is private so you can enjoy the experience in comfort. I have to confess, I was at some point out of my senses and just allowed the lady to do her thing....AMAZING. If you staying, dont miss this experience. It was my birthday treat to myself and what a fabulous one. Had one before in Antalya, but this one was way better. Also there is internet available in the spa area for guests, free of charge which is helpful. All in all, a great hotel in a lovely location, minutes away from the Blue Mosque, Haga Sophia, etc. Thank you Ms Zehra, sorry we didnt get to say Bye, and Mr Cenzig, and the wonderful housekeeping staff, always ready to assist with smiles on their face. You made our visit soo very special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Reasonable Rate and Great & Lovely People”
Reviews.Author: Taurus170569
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to Istanbul, my wife and I have spend a great 5 days trip in Istanbul thanks to The Byzantium Hotel. Firstly, I would like to thanks Mr. Genghis (hope I have spell his name correctly) and the staff of The Byzantium Hotel. Mr. Genghis is knowledgeable, friendly and patient person I have ever met. He is able to provide us with all the information required to travel around Istanbul. The hotel staffs are friendly and helpful. The room is spacious and clean, there is nothing else we can complain as we are pamper by the sea view room offer by Mr. Genghis without additional charges. I strongly recommended this hotel because of the location where by we are able to travel anywhere conveniently around the city with public transport. We have the privacy and quietness even though it is near to the Blue Mosque. Once again, thanks to the staffs of The Byzantium Hotel that make us have an enjoyable and unforgettable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Sleep Between Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: MKseetheworld
Reviews.Content: In general, the stay was fine. It was well located for walking around the city. We rarely used a cab except to and from the airport. Plenty of wonderful food around as well. However, the rooms varied in size and quality among the same rate. We were traveling with extended family and had booked and checked in at the same time, paying the same rate for three rooms. One was spectacular but located in a different area, one was an average sized room, like you would expect at a US airport hotel, and one was the size of a walk in closet. The window was narrow and overlooked the roof and the kitchen-this caused a host of issues that were never resolved. 1)All of the rooms were overly warm and stuffy. We repeatedly asked for help with the heating as it was spring, and warm enough to be without coats- and did not need the heat blasting in the rooms. 2) we had one small window-no ability for cross ventilation but HAD to keep it open. The location meant that we had all the smells and sounds-including people on their cigarette break and music at 5am wafting into our room. 3) We were there for 10 days, and daily asked that they not spray the room with febreeze as the combination of stuffyness and smoke was to much with perfumed spray. Every day they assured us they would cease, and every night it was clear the room had been sprayed again. The bed was not great but not terrible. There was barely two feet space on any side around the bed. That's how small the room was. Not pleasant. Breakfast-was amazing and included.

Reviews.Title: “Dime a dozen hotels like this in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: TravelmaniaHongKong
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is terrible, it would not take much to renovate it and make it more luminous and fresh, it gives the impression of being dirty and dated (which I suspect it is). The hotel advertises its spa and hammam but surely you can find much better in Istanbul, I did not try either. The breakfast is so sad, only pre-packaged stuff, served inattentively in a dark room, most people opt to have breakfast outside on the street (where cars pass by) but you have to bring out all the stuff yourself. They have a great terrace but I guess is too much work for the staff to prepare itâ€¦ That said, the room was clean and fairly modern. The bathroom was clean although small. The strangest thing was that in the bathroom one could hear all the conversation going on in the next roomâ€¦.not very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: NatDubai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very good spot, walking distance from Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Hagiya Sofia (both, large and small), Yerebatan and Grand Bazaar. The front desk manager (Mr. Chingiz) is very helpful and very quick to respond to requests for services. Try to get a room with the sea view as the street is very active at night so it gets a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A very secure and comfortable stay in Ä°stanbul...”
Reviews.Author: Sema88
Reviews.Content: The Byzantium Hotel is located in Sultanahmet a very central area of Ä°stanbul a short walk from the Sultan Ahmet Mosque (Blue Mosque) Aya Sofia and Topkapi. The hotel is also quite close to different modes of public transport the trams take you to Kabatas from which you can catch a ferry or bus to most parts of Istanbul. The hotel staff are incredibloy helpful they are approachable and friendly and most can speak English and communicate very effectively. The manager Cengiz Bey (Mr. Cengiz) will be able to help you with any queries you may have. He is sure to go to any lengths to make your stay in Istanbul as pleul. asant as possible. The hotel is clean very comfortable and very secure. There is wireless internet and spa services for guests to make use of. Breakfast was always very appetising. I would recommend this hotel to those who are considering a trip to Ä°stanb

Reviews.Title: “Mr Cengiz was a miracle worker”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeHuff
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager, Mr Cengiz, responded to each of our requests for information & help with the assurance that everything would be taken care of - and he came through for us every time !!! He worked miracles for us ! Immediately and completely. He made our stay worry free and so much more enjoyable. And he saved us time, effort and money !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonTweety
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and made our trip even more enjoyable. The manager Jengis was very welcoming when we arrived and sat us down with tea before informing us of day trip/sites to see etc. The first triple room we booked was very spacious, but wasnt suitable for my dad, so Jengis upgraded it to a superior room with a sea view. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful expecially Shezad. It was a great location, being nearby to lots of attactions. The restaurant with terrace view of the the Bleu Mosque and see was good, as was breakfast. The hammam was also really good and has the benefit of being private. My family and I had an amazing holday which was contributed by the fact we had a great hotel to stay at that made our holiday a relaxing one. Would definatley come again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice.”
Reviews.Author: csmschooltrips
Reviews.Content: Byzantium offers incredibly helpful staff, a great tourist location, a large open lobby, great breakfast options, beautiful rooftop views, clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a quiet night's rest in the middle of a busy tourist area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The Manager was EXTREMELY helpful and resourceful!”
Reviews.Author: thebeloved
Reviews.Content: The manager, Genghis, was well connected, was able to work with our budget and large group, and saved us many problems and headaches. He knew good tour guides, good restaurants, when things were open and closed, and the best ways to get places. Our trip would have been quite the headache if we had not had him around. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and gracious staff!”
Reviews.Author: happytrails62010
Reviews.Content: Mr Ozgur Kurubacak, Mr Cengiz and all the staff at the Byzantium were extremely gracious to me and my wife. Everyone was so helpful when we checked in on June 2, 2010 for our first night of our stay. Cengiz was helpful in making suggestions of places for us to visit in our short stay in Istanbul. We, unfortunately, had to cut our planned visit short because of the British Airways strike. This caused us to have to reschedule, one day sooner, our flight back to London. Both Mr. Ozgur Kurubacak and Mr. Cengiz helped in connecting us with Brithish Airways in the rescheduling of our flight. In the short time and many experiences we had at the Byzantium Hotel and Istanbul, we have very happy memories. The rooftop restaurant was a lovely choice for our evening dining experience. We had a delicous meal and the view was incredible. We could see the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia lit up so beautifully. We were fortunate to take several wonderful photos of these sites. The restaurant manager was quite a conversationalist, and we truly enjoyed all the insight he shared with us during the evening. We truly enjoyed chatting with him. We hope to return to Istanbul and, of course, the Byzantium Hotel in the near future so that we can complete all the adventures we had planned on doing during this shortened trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ameen_Neyaz
Reviews.Content: We staid there for 6 non-continuous nights. Clean, nice, comfortable rooms. We had a street view room. It was nice but a bit noisy at night. We prefer if you can get a sea view room. very friendly and helpful staff. It was an average 4-star hotel as we expected. Great location, very near to many attraction and not that far from tram station. Breakfast was not the best thing there from variety point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeoffNYCNy_Ny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (in our early 60's) spent 3 days at the Byzantium Hotel in late May. It is an excellent hotel situated a few hundred yards from the Blue Mosque in a nice busy neighborhood. The management and staff were most attentive and made us feel right at home. The roof restaurant/bar was the perfect place to unwind and the views at sunset were lovely. We both took a Turkish bath in the spa, which is situated in the hotel and I have never felt so relaxed. I heartily recommend the Byzantium Hotel. Regards - Geoff A

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking habit”
Reviews.Author: kalubanther
Reviews.Content: Just been talking to hotels.com following overbooking for first night. To recap Byzantium had overbooked first night and put us in really awful hotel. Terrible experience. Yes they paid for this crap hotel. Yes the paid for taxis. And now hotels.com have offered us a refund on the first night. Now I read some of the other experiences and it is clear that BYZANTIUM HAVE AN OVERBOOKING POLICY. Do they not get it that overbooking is not at all acceptable !!! We had already paid a long time before we got there. Who is going to compensate for the loss of 1 day of our time in Istanbul ? My abiding memory of this hotel is my parents, my kids and my wife getting our luggage out of the taxi and the sight of Ozgur's sidekick waving his arms around hysterically saying ' no room no room'. It was like an episode of Faulty Towers. Avoid this hotel like the plague...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: sheilasBrighton
Reviews.Content: Roof restuarant has great views of Sea of Marmara and the location is very central.Food good quality and reasonable price. Hotel staff eager to please and very helpful. Overall we stayed for 6 nights and had a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great position mediocre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Thai_Rain
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Byzantine on the last leg of our 2 week tour of Turkey having being married in Gunogan. As we had stayed in the same area before (Sultanamet) we were eager to return but had to choose a different hotel to our previous one which was full. On a recommendation regarding the Turkish spa at the Byzantium we decided to also stay in the hotel. There's not a lot to say as it is a fairly mediocre hotel with cheap fittings in the rooms, (we stayed in two rooms as they had "forgotton" to book our sea view room and put us in a 'suite' for the first night). The hotel advertises soundproof rooms, however at least in the 'suite' which is on the ground floor, it couldn't be much noisier if it tried. The windows opened to a small street where people constantly sat in drunken states all evening and the air conditioning didn't work (neither did it work in the sea view room which we were moved into the following day). It is a good size room but with no thought to decor or ambiance. I felt more like I was locked in a dungeon. The sea view room is no more inspiring. Yes, it does have a view of the sea, but it is a very small room with scant decor and no real ambiance either. So for position I give this hotel a 10 but for value for money and charm a 0 unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: verona_9002
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a fantastic stay in Istanbul - The Byzantium Hotel is in a great location, being only a few minutes walk away from many of the major sights. The room was clean, and staff were friendly. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “that's ok”
Reviews.Author: tgiulia
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights there. When we arrived we discovered they made a mistake with our reservation. They thought we were arriving one day later, but they admitted it was their fault and they sent us in hotel just in front without paying anything more. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room is nothing special but clean. The breakfast is average. The spa is nice but expensive, I would prefer an historic hamman in the city centre. The location of the hotel is fine, very close to the monuments and to some restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on a busy street of Sultanahmet!!”
Reviews.Author: nabze
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel located in the heart of Istanbul! All major tourist attractions are located within walking distance of hotel. Hotel staff are very friendly and food is pretty good. Hotel managers are Ozgur and Genghis who will without a doubt make your stay feel pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “No room at the inn.”
Reviews.Author: apm1500
Reviews.Content: Not much to say. We booked through expedia but when we arrived they said they were full. They were very nice about and put us up in the hotel across the road. No problems, lots of apologies and free use of their facilities. Handled fine but it would have been nice to stay at the hotel you book with.

Reviews.Title: “Book with caution”
Reviews.Author: redmozzy
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel over easter through Hostelworld (one of the worlds largest accomodation booking websites, and we'd previously book 18 hotels/hostels in 10 different countries with no hassles) and they claimed to of never received our booking, and said they're never heard of hostelworld, and that they must be a fake website (yeah right). This hotel has good reviews, and i'm sure its nice (for Istanbul anyways) but there are alot of reviews about lost bookings etc. We have a feeling we fell prey to overbooking scams of taking the highest payer (particularly being Easter). We were driven 25 mins west of the Sultanahmet to their 2nd 1 star hotel, in a very bad area. Said the 1st night would be free (but of course charged us for two) and that they would move us back when a rooms was free. By day two we never heard from the manager and decided to cut out losses and check out. A very horrible introduction to Istanbul for us. Basically ruined our Easter break. Again, it seemed like a nice place, centrally located (from the lobby) but definitely overbooking is a common occurance.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: PEJM
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel located near all the main tourist attractions, perfect is this is what you are after from a trip, though the area is made up of tourists and subsequently overpriced for average establishments. As with most cities the most interesting taste of local life, best eateries and hangouts are located a distance away from this area. We pre-paid our room for 3 nights though on arrival were told they had overbooked for the first night and we would have to stay at the hotel opposite. We were given a voucher for the spa to compensate for the inconvenience. On arrival the room was small but clean and the staff ok, overall the hotel was good for a fist taste of Istanbul but would find alternative accommodation the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Faheyj
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Byzantium Hotel for 4 nights at end of March / beginning of April. Everything about the hotel was excellent - receptionists - room - breakfast but primarily location. We also sampled the hotel's Spa and really enjoyed the experience - treat yourself if you are there. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Sultanahmet Square with the Grand Bazaar a further 10 mins walk. The local tram stop at the Sultanahmet allows you explore the city further. However, the tram, metro and bus system took us 3 days to figure out! Eating out in Istanbul is a pleasure and very reasonable - compared to Irish prices. There are many cafes & restaurants on the street outside the Byzantium Hotel the choice being the Metropolis Restaurant. Around the Sultanahmet area there is a huge range the best two we found were Amedros and our favourite - Kir Evi, both on a small street opposite 'MacDonalds' - yes it is in Istanbul also.

Reviews.Title: “Very splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isgoma
Reviews.Content: My wife Marta and me had to come to Istanbul for business. We wanted a Hotel near the historical sites and at the same time quiet to be able to relax after shopping costume jewellery, silver, clothes and other stuff. The Hotel Bizantium was perfect for the plan. Everybody was very kind, the room was beautiful, clean, good bathroom and comfortable bed. The breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Mention apart is for the Hammam which was very relaxing. We reccomend Byzantium Hotel to anyone who wanbts to spend time in Istanbul either for business or just holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: lubavatsya
Reviews.Content: The hotel was initially chosen for its location. It is really perfect for everyone who is interested in culture and sightseeing trip as it situates in the heart of the old part of the city in five minute walk from AyaSofya,Blue Mosque and topkapi palace. Very friendly and helpful managment and staff made our stay pleasant and comfortable. Room was not big but cosy with comfortable beds. Breakfast had enough varieties to choose from though the menu was the same all five days we stayed. The hotel situates on the street crowded with small cafes, lokantas and restraunts but the prices are a bit higher then in restraunts that are located around Sultanahmet Square. There is a good Spa-center in the hotel with steam room, sauna and hamam. Massage was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “They did not give me the type of room I had booked and refused to refund the difference.”
Reviews.Author: shely91
Reviews.Content: I booked a "superior single room with see view" in this hotel through the site "hotels .ca" for two nights. When I arrived there from Canada they said that they had not had any reservation under my name and they could give me only a normal single room but not "superior single room with see view" for which I had paid $50CAD extra. Fortunately, On the check out time they had got the reservation information and I did not have to pay twice. They told me that they would do the arrangements with the agency I had used to do the reservation to refund the extra money I had paid for "see view room". But any effort form the hotels.ca customer service to get the refund from the hotel was useless and the hotel refused to return my $50CAD. Unbelievable that they risk they reputation for $50 CAD.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location and lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Marion276
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. It's in a great location, which is obviously important, but also the place is spotlessly clean and the staff are all incredibly helpful and friendly: they happpily put themselves out to help you. There is a spa in the basement, which we didn't use. We did go and have a look around down there though, and it looked gorgeous. Our room faced out on to Cankurtaran, so it was a little noisy at night, but that's not the hotel's fault: it's a busy little street, lined with hotels, restaurants and bars. Also, we were hardly in early ourselves, so it didn't really bother us. We had a quick peek through the door of one of the rooms facing out over the water, and the views looked lovely, so request one of those rooms if you prefer less noise and a view. If and when I go back to Istanbul, I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: gudzey
Reviews.Content: This was a tremendous holiday for all the right reasons. The manager Ozgur was a fantastic host who was always willing to offer the best possible advice and support. He went out of his way to please you and make you feel comfortable. Jangez was a real laugh as he continually had us in creases with his jokes! Their hospitality was infectious with other staff as well. Ozgur made my stay even more pleasant by locating three of my Turkish friends one of whom I met, with his and Jangez's help, after 32 years!!!! What great people they are! I will treasure this gesture forever as all previous attempts to find my friends went in vain. I only wish I had asked Ozgur to help me on the first day that I arrived at the hotel instead of the penultimate day of our five day holiday. The hotel was quaint, clean, tidy, beautifully located in the heart of the old city within 100mteres of the Sultan Ahmet Mosque. I would wake up to the crescendo of the call to prayer from all around the local mosques. Truly, an amazing experience!! The Topkapi Palace was an eyeopener in itself and allowed you to marvel at the great Ottoman Emperors. This was literally five minutes walk away our hotel. The Sophia Hagia was mo more than 150metres away. The underground cistern was two minutes walk from this. You couldn't have wished to be nearer to all the main sightseeing locations. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and there was a great variety of food both English and Continental / European. As the weather wasn't terribly warm we were not able to get on the terrace. The rooom we had was pleasant with a gorgeous view of the Bhosphorous Sea. This wasquite simply breathtaking. The staff were always polite and friendly, offering apple tea almost each time we returned from an outing. This was true of any shop you might venture into. This kind of hospitality will knock you for six. Ozgur and Jangez you rock!!!!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody if, like us, you want to experience the old city. We will return, hopefully before 32 years!!!! Thank you once again for everything you all did for us. Mr & Mrs Hussain Sheffield England

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills, great location.”
Reviews.Author: MCSW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a three-day break. The first night we arrived at midnight, and our room was tiny, with no chest of drawers, no chairs and only one bedside table. The bathroom was compact, and there was one tiny bar of soap and small bottle of white liquid with no label. We moved the next day to a bigger room, but it was not much more luxurious. The rooms are dimly lit, and the hallways are installed with light sensors, so it was always a bit dark. The walls are thin, so one can easily hear ones' neighbours. It's not a particularly inviting place to return to after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast was simple and unchanging, with a Nescafe machine producing instant coffee, fresh bread and the standard olives, cold cuts and cheeses, whole fruit and plain yogurt. Bottom line is the service is friendly enough, the rooms are spartan but clean, and the location is excellent if you are trying to pack all of the big monuments into a short stay. It is not ideal for a romantic or relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Istanbul - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ZahierA
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Istanbul, the Hotel was ideally located for all the major sights in Istanbul which included the Blue Mosque, AyaSofia and TopKapi Museum. All the staff were friendly and very helpful...............lots of restaraunts on the same street so you cannot really go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms and average service”
Reviews.Author: notafoodie
Reviews.Content: We had booked a Superior room with seaview; when we checked in and went to our room, this was a bigger room but facing a wall. When we called reception, the Manager came around and apologised but they were double booked and prom,ised to move us to his best room the next day. To compensate, he offerred us dinner and free use of sauna/steam. The following day we were moved to a supposedly excellent room but was small with insufficient space to get in and out of the bed easily, no set of drawers, no table, tiny tv and the smallest bathroom we have seen anywhere. The point is that when checking us in, they knew we were not being given the type of room we had booked but failed to mention this, i.e. they wouldn't have said anything if we hadn't complained and the Manager was not interested enough to check that we were happy after moving us. By the way, breakfast was limited in variety and the same everyday for the five days we were there. Finally, whilst one would expect to pay for a Turkish bath, massage etc., we did not expect to have to pay for the sauna or the steam room.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: shonabobbies
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect for the 'must see' sites. The staff are friendly, welcoming and can cater for all your needs. The booked room was not available on our arrival but the room we had was extremely comfortable and spacious. As a result we were offered discount and free use of the sauna and spa. The massage was well worth the extra money. The roof top views over the Sea of Marmara were made even better whilst sitting in the sun.There was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but if I had asked, I am sure there could have been but as the Hotel is surrounded by restaurants, bars and cafe's where there was always a friendly welcome it w did not really matter. The breakfast was more than adequate and the tea and cake (free) in the afternoon was an added bonus. If you needed to know anything, Melissa, the guest relations lady, could answer it. Overall, having stayed in Turkey many times, the Byzantium Hotel is of a very high standard and I would not hesitate in recommending it or going back (which i will do one day)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Andel10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for four nights in October 2009. Everything about our stay was excellent. The hotel offers a free airport transfer to guests who book directly, and unusually, the rates offered were the same as those available through booking websites. On arrival to driver was waiting for us and delivered us to the hotel. The room was excellent with double doors looking out over the Bosphorus. It was spacious and well furnished and although the bathroom was small, it was well equipped. The hotel staff were helpful and well informed, and each day between 1600 and 1800, guests can have complimentary coffee and cake on the rooftop terrace. Again the view are magnificent. The hotel is very well place for all of the key tourist sights, the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia are just a few minutes walk away. There are lots of good restaurants in the locality. Overall we were made to feel very welcome and had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireAngela
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful, The location is good. The hotel was very clean and warm ( It snowed all the time we were in Istanbul!) The turkish bath on the lower ground floor was great. We would recommend this hotel. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Aloutte
Reviews.Content: Me and family have spent a really good time. It was a fun place and very good location and you can reach to any place because the tram is very near. The staff of hotel were very helpful and nice. We felt like we were at home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lindajoyca
Reviews.Content: Lovely little boutique hotel in the very center of the tourist attractions. A couple of blocks to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. A few more blocks to Topkapi Palace and a 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. The room was small but with its view overlooking the Sea of Marmara (we were on the 4th floor) it felt larger. It was beautifully appointed and had everything we required. The staff was wonderful and most helpful and attentive. On a great little street lined with shops and restaurants. Our favorite restaurant was the Blue Turquoise directly across the street. We would definitely return and I have recommended the hotel to friends already.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was staying with good friends.”
Reviews.Author: kokobeans
Reviews.Content: The Byzantium was located close to everything. The facility was clean and very comfortable. Melisa and Fatih were very helpful in giving directions to destinations and made excellent suggestions on tours. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, very nice staff, felt at home!”
Reviews.Author: cherimoya88
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and plan to use it again. Reasonable rates, very clean, good attentive service, our room overlooking the Bosphorus was lovely, loved the area, so close to all the sights and the Bazaar. The breakfast was not good, although t plentiful with generous portions. I would go to a restaurant instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roux
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for a four day trip to Istanbul - close to all the sights and clean rooms. The breakfast is fine and plentiful - though fresh coffee would have been appreciated. The rooms though small are adequate and clean. The staff are friendly and can't do enough for you - we arrived after a long overnight flight and they got us a room immediately instead of having to wait until the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mzmazz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Byzantium Hotel, located less than 5 minutes from the BLUE MOSQUE, AYA SOFIA, TOPKAPI PALACE and other must see Instanbuli sites. The staff here have been beyond superb. Without fail they have been friendly and helpful and accommodating. I've traveled to a number of different cities in Europe and North America and never have I been treated so well. There is nothing, nothing at all that I can quibble with. The guest relations officer, Melisa, is a gem. She really knows her stuff and will go out of her way to help you find just the right excursion. The SPA FOR LIFE here in the hotel offers a wide range of services at more than competitive rates compared to those in other parts of the city. Should you choose to stay here, you will find yourself close to shopping, attractions and restaurants. The hotel is ideally situated for your stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel near all the sites with extremely helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mumsarebest
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely long weekend break in Istanbul & much of the credit goes to our experience at the Byzantium.hotel. It is ideally situated to visit all of the best sites being only a stones throw from the Blue Mosque. The hotel itself is vey nice and has the extra touches that elevate it above the norm; for instance every afternoon the hotel offers guests complemetary tea, coffee & cakes in the restaurant; Everymorning at breakfast & during the complementary tea/coffee Mellissa, the hotel representative, was always available to give any advice or help needed to make our stay as enjoyable as possible; on arriving & leaving the hotel the porter rushed to help us with our bags; in fact nothing seemed too much trouble for the entire staff we met during our stay. We had been concerned over the breaKfast before our visit as had read some bad reviews from last year (after we booked) but the hotel has obviously rectified this & both the choice of food & quality was excellent. All in all we would greatly recommend this hotel & definitely stay there again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend”
Reviews.Author: EventMassagno
Reviews.Content: After an absence of 10 years it was a pleasant surprise to see the improvements in Istanbul Old Town, in particular the restoration work done and dedication to keeping the Past alive. The Byzantium Hotel is ideally located. It is close to the major tourist spots and an extremely easy walk to these. Melisa of Guest Relations gave us a very warm welcome, as well as much tourist information. The staff always smiled and greeted. Cingiz at reception was a big help too. It is nice to know that there is Afternoon Tea - sore feet need a rest. For those who like to sleep, remember that the first muezzin call is around 5.45 a.m. so keep your windows shut. I rather enjoyed this early wake-up call. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: CrossedDestinies
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel.
